title: South Korea protesters rally for, against Yoon arrest as deadline looms - Reuters
summary:
South Korea protesters rally for, against Yoon arrest as deadline looms

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Reuters

Thousands gathered in Seoul amid heavy snow to rally both for and against the arrest of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol as a critical legal deadline approaches.

  • Yoon's lawyers claim the arrest warrant is unconstitutional.
  • The arrest warrant against Yoon expires at 1500 GMT on Monday.
  • The Seoul Western District Court has rejected a complaint about the warrant being illegal.
"Judging the legitimacy of any legal interpretation and execution is difficult." - Seok Dong-hyeon, lawyer advising Yoon

The protests underscore a deepening political crisis in South Korea, as the nation grapples with the implications of a presidential impeachment.
newTitle: Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol's Arrest

title: "Just Because I'm An Indian...": Sunil Gavaskar On Not Being Invited To Present Border-Gavaskar Trop.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Just Because I'm An Indian...: Sunil Gavaskar On Not Being Invited To Present Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Code Sports

Sunil Gavaskar, the legendary cricketer, expressed his disappointment after being overlooked during the presentation ceremony for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which honors both him and Allan Border. This event followed Australia's six-wicket victory over India in the series.

  • Sunil Gavaskar was present at the venue but was not invited to present the trophy.
  • Australia reclaimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after a ten-year gap.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of the trophy, stating it signifies the rivalry between India and Australia.
  • The recent series drew record crowds and broke a long-standing attendance record at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
"Just because I am an Indian. I would have been happy to present the trophy with my good friend Allan Border," - Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's comments highlight the significance of his role in cricket and the expectations surrounding such iconic trophies.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Expresses Displeasure Over Missing Border-Gavaskar Trophy Presentation

What is Indian-origin Kevan Parekh’s salary as Apple’s new CFO? - Hindustan Times
summary:
What is Indian-origin Kevan Parekh’s salary as Apple’s new CFO?

Date: January 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Indian-origin Kevan Parekh, appointed as the CFO of Apple effective January 1, 2025, will receive an annual salary of $1 million (₹8.57 crore).

  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and has significant experience in finance roles.
  • He previously held leadership positions at Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Parekh succeeds Luca Maestri in Apple's CFO transition plan.
  • Tim Cook praised Parekh's intelligence and judgment in his new role.
  • His annual compensation includes participation in Apple’s Executive Cash Incentive Plan with a target opportunity of 175% of base salary.
“For more than a decade, Kevan has been an indispensable member of Apple's finance leadership team.” – Tim Cook

This appointment highlights Apple’s commitment to maintaining strong financial leadership during a key transition period.
newTitle: Kevan Parekh Appointed as Apple's New CFO with $1 Million Salary

title: Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top: Gautam Gambhir

Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

In a recent press conference, India’s head coach Gautam Gambhir praised Rohit Sharma for prioritizing the team's needs over his personal batting form during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which India lost 1-3 to Australia.

  • Rohit Sharma missed the first Test to be with his family for the birth of his second child.
  • He batted in the middle order for two Tests to maintain the opening partnership but struggled with scores of 3 and 6.
  • His return to the opening position in the fourth Test did not improve his score, adding just 11 runs.
  • Eventually, he rested for the final Test after a prolonged slump in form.
  • Gambhir emphasized Rohit’s accountability, stating, "To keep the dressing room happy, I have to be honest and fair to everyone."
  • The loss against Australia means India missed out on the World Test Championship final and ended a decade-long hold on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"Rohit Sharma showed accountability at the top," said Gautam Gambhir.

This series loss highlights the challenges the Indian cricket team is currently facing as they undergo a transitional phase.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Commends Rohit Sharma's Accountability in Tough Times

title: Venus dazzles next to crescent Moon in rare celestial spectacle - NewsBytes
summary:
Venus dazzles next to crescent Moon in rare celestial spectacle

Date: January 2023 Source: NewsBytes

This week, a mesmerizing celestial event unfolded as Venus, our nearest planetary neighbor, shone brightly above a crescent Moon.

  • The spectacle was visible to the naked eye in several regions including the UK, US, Turkey, China, and India.
  • Venus's alignment with the Moon is a rare occurrence, making it a captivating event for stargazers.
  • Upcoming celestial events include the Quadrantid meteor shower peaking and Mars' opposition in January.
  • Stargazers are advised to find locations away from light pollution for optimal viewing.
“Dr. Robert Massey, the Deputy Director of the UK's Royal Astronomical Society, advises stargazers to allow at least 15 minutes for their eyes to adjust to darkness.”

This celestial spectacle serves as a reminder of the beauty of our night sky and the rarity of such events, encouraging continued interest in astronomy.
newTitle: Venus Shines Next to Crescent Moon in Spectacular Celestial Event

title: Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi weather: Several flights, trains delayed as dense fog grips national capital; mercury dips to 10°C

Date: Published on January 5, 2025

Source: Times of India

Severe fog conditions in Delhi have led to significant delays in flights and trains, with temperatures dropping to as low as 10°C. The weather situation has caused widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Dense fog has resulted in multiple flight cancellations and delays.
  • Train services have been severely affected, with many trains running late.
  • Weather forecasts predict continued fog conditions for the next few days.
“The visibility is very low, affecting both air and rail transport.”

Officials are advising travelers to check the status of their journeys before heading out and to remain patient as the weather conditions persist.
newTitle: Dense Fog Causes Flight and Train Delays in Delhi as Temperature Drops to 10°C

title: 5 most beautiful images of nebula captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
summary:
5 Most Beautiful Images of Nebula Captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: India.com

This article showcases the five most beautiful nebula images captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique characteristics and significance to astronomy.

  • The Ghost Nebula in the constellation of Cassiopeia exhibits flowing veils of gas and dust.
  • The Horsehead Nebula is shown in infrared light to commemorate the Hubble's launch anniversary.
  • The Eagle Nebula, also known as Messier 16, has provided numerous iconic images.
  • The Orion Nebula is noted for having the sharpest view obtained by Hubble.
  • The image of NGC 6530 depicts a wall of smoke blended with bright stars.
“Thanks for reading!”

This article celebrates the beauty and significance of nebula imagery captured by Hubble, inspiring further exploration and appreciation of the universe.
newTitle: 5 Most Beautiful Images of Nebula Captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

title: "Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 • Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, India head coach Gautam Gambhir addressed questions regarding the future of senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma following the team's defeat in Sydney.

  • Gambhir refused to comment definitively on the future of Kohli and Sharma, citing their 'hunger' as a deciding factor.
  • He emphasized the need to be fair to all players in the team, regardless of experience.
  • Both players have struggled with form recently, raising questions about their selection for upcoming matches.
  • Rohit Sharma appeared in an interview expressing his commitment to continue playing despite retirement rumors.
  • The selectors face challenges in deciding the future of the veteran players as India prepares for a series in England.
"I can't comment on the future of any Players, it is up to them. They have the hunger and commitment - hopefully they can do everything they can to take Indian cricket forward." - Gautam Gambhir

The upcoming selections for India's Test squad will significantly impact the team's future dynamics, especially concerning seasoned players like Kohli and Sharma.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Discusses Future of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

title: BJP MLA claims ‘50,000 cows slaughtered daily in Uttar Pradesh’, accuses govt of silence - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP MLA Claims 50,000 Cows Slaughtered Daily in Uttar Pradesh

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MLA Nand Kishore Gujar has alleged that the Yogi Adityanath government is complicit in the daily slaughter of 50,000 cows in Uttar Pradesh, expressing concerns over official corruption and urging resolution at the highest levels.

  • Nand Kishore Gujar claims 50,000 cows are slaughtered every day under the current government.
  • He alleges that corrupt officials are misusing funds meant for cow welfare.
  • Gujar expresses frustration over the lack of government action on this issue.
  • He warns that unchecked corruption could affect the BJP's performance in the upcoming elections.
  • Akhilesh Yadav criticizes BJP infighting and its impact on public interests.
  • A separate incident highlights a lynching in Moradabad linked to cow slaughter accusations.
“If action is taken against these corrupt officials, the BJP could win as many as 375 seats in the next assembly elections.”

The claims by MLA Gujar shed light on serious allegations against officials in Uttar Pradesh, raising questions regarding animal welfare and government accountability.

title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling match, Australia claimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after defeating India by 6 wickets, clinching the series 3-1. This win marks a significant moment for Australia, who had not won the trophy in a decade.

  • Travis Head (34*) and Beau Webster (39*) led Australia to victory.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah missed the match due to injury, impacting India's bowling lineup.
  • Australia scored 162 runs to win after India was bowled out for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved a remarkable 10-wicket haul across both innings.
  • India is now out of contention for the World Test Championship Final.
“Unreal. Few of us didn't have. Lived up to all the hype...Immensely proud.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Australia's strong performance throughout the series allowed them to regain the trophy, while India faced challenges due to injuries and missed opportunities.
newTitle: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3: Australia Wins Border-Gavaskar Trophy

4 Maoists Gunned Down, 1 Security Personnel Dies In Chhattisgarh Encounter - NDTV
summary:
Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

An encounter between Maoists and security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of four Maoists and one security personnel. The clash occurred during an anti-Maoist operation in the forests of Narayanpur and Dantewada districts.

  • Four Maoists were killed during a face-off with security personnel.
  • One head constable from the District Reserve Guard (DRG) named Sannu Karam lost his life.
  • Security forces were conducting an anti-Maoist operation when the encounter took place.
  • After the exchange of fire, bodies of the Maoists and their weapons were recovered.
  • In 2024, over 200 Maoists have been killed, with a focus on eradicating this insurgency by March 2026.
  • 18 security personnel have reportedly died in anti-Maoist operations this year, alongside 65 civilians due to Maoist violence.
“Amit Shah vowing to eradicate them by March 2026.”

The ongoing operations highlight the persistent conflict between security forces and Maoist insurgents in the region, with the government emphasizing its commitment to restoring peace.
newTitle: Four Maoists Killed in Chhattisgarh Encounter, One Security Personnel Dies

title: Arjun Kapoor makes a rare mention of late stepmother Sridevi, calls her ‘ma’am’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Arjun Kapoor Reflects on Late Stepmother Sridevi in Rare Mention

Date: Jan 05, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent interview, Bollywood actor Arjun Kapoor made a rare mention of his late stepmother, legendary actress Sridevi, discussing her in the context of a film set where they both shared a significant connection.

  • Arjun referenced Sridevi while discussing the film 'Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja'.
  • The film was produced by his father Boney Kapoor and featured Sridevi alongside Anil Kapoor.
  • Sridevi was dating Boney Kapoor during the film's production while he was still married to Arjun's mother, Mona Kapoor.
  • Arjun expressed a protective feeling towards his stepsisters after Sridevi's tragic passing in 2018.
  • His upcoming film 'Mere Husband Ki Biwi' is set for release on February 21.
“My entire life with my father was being on Roop Ki Rani Choron Ka Raja set... Even by today’s standards, it is one of the biggest films we ever made.” - Arjun Kapoor

This mention highlights Arjun's deep connection to his family and the impact of Sridevi's presence in his life, despite her early passing.

title: Joe Biden honours Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Lionel Messi with Presidential Medal of Freedom - The Hindu
summary:
Joe Biden honours Hillary Clinton, George Soros, Lionel Messi with Presidential Medal of Freedom

Published: January 05, 2025 Source: The Hindu

On January 4, 2025, President Joe Biden presented the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, to several notable figures including Hillary Clinton and George Soros. The ceremony, held in the East Room of the White House, recognized individuals who have significantly impacted American culture and ideals.

  • President Biden awarded the Medal to 16 individuals, including Hillary Clinton, George Soros, and others.
  • Due to a scheduling conflict, Lionel Messi was not present to receive his award.
  • Biden emphasized the extraordinary contributions of the recipients in shaping American culture and humanitarian efforts.
  • Hillary Clinton received a standing ovation for her extensive contributions to society as a lawyer, First Lady, Senator, and Secretary of State.
  • Posthumous awards were given to notable figures like Fannie Lou Hamer and Robert F. Kennedy.
  • The awarding process faced criticism from Republican leaders who opposed Soros receiving the honor.
“The Presidential Medal of Freedom is awarded to George Soros. Born into a Jewish family in Hungary, George Soros escaped Nazi occupation to build a life of freedom...”

Overall, the event highlighted the importance of recognizing individuals committed to the ideals of freedom and democracy in America, while also sparking significant political controversy regarding some recipients.
newTitle: Joe Biden Honors Notable Figures with Presidential Medal of Freedom

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Filmmaker Jeff Baena, known for his works including Life After Beth and Joshy, was found dead in a Los Angeles residence at the age of 47. The cause of death is currently under investigation.

  • Baena directed notable films such as Life After Beth, Joshy, and The Little Hours.
  • He was married to actress Aubrey Plaza, who starred in many of his films.
  • Baena expressed his passion for cinema was influenced by films like A Clockwork Orange and 8 1/2.

“The opportunities to create together, to do something creative where we’re both fulfilled, it’s like how rare is that?” - Jeff Baena

Baena's death has raised questions about mental health and the pressures faced by those in the entertainment industry. His contributions to cinema will be remembered.

PM Modi to inaugurate 13-km Delhi section of Namo Bharat corridor today - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi to Inaugurate 13-km Delhi Section of Namo Bharat Corridor Today

Published on: January 05, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate a 13-km section of the Namo Bharat corridor, enhancing connectivity between Sahibabad and New Ashok Nagar.

  • The inauguration is scheduled for 11 a.m., with train services starting at 5 p.m.
  • The fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South will be ₹150 for a standard coach and ₹225 for a premium coach.
  • This section includes 6 km of underground rail and has a prominent station at Anand Vihar.
  • Train operations will reduce travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South to around 40 minutes.
  • The project aims to ease congestion by removing over 100,000 private vehicles from roads.
“Namo Bharat trains have served over 50 lakh commuters to date.”

The inauguration marks a significant expansion of the Namo Bharat project, providing direct connectivity to Meerut from Delhi.
newTitle: PM Modi to Launch New Section of Namo Bharat Corridor in Delhi

title: Ex-Armymen arrested after 19 years for killing 17-day-old twins and their mother - Hindustan Times
HMPV outbreak in China: Is it a new virus? How is it similar to Covid-19? Is there any vaccine? What we know so far | Mint - Mint
summary:
HMPV Outbreak in China: Understanding the Virus and Its Similarities to COVID-19

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Live Mint

An outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in China is raising global concerns, prompting countries like India to closely monitor the situation. Experts are evaluating the virus’s similarities to COVID-19, its symptoms, and the lack of a vaccine.

Key Points

  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus causing infections similar to RSV and flu.
  • It was first discovered in 2001, but evidence suggests it has existed since 1958.
  • HMPV and COVID-19 share similar symptoms such as cough, fever, and shortness of breath.
  • There is currently no vaccine for HMPV.
  • Precautions include hand hygiene and avoiding close contact with sick individuals.
Dr. Atul Goel stated, “We analysed the data of respiratory outbreaks within the country, there is no substantial increase in 2024 data.”

Overall, while the HMPV outbreak is concerning, experts recommend general precautions and reassurances about preparedness in the healthcare system.
newTitle: HMPV Outbreak in China: Understanding the Virus and Its Similarities to COVID-19
